conclusion: The laser beam is irradiating perpendicular to AC towards point P, but since P is moving, the point of incidence changes with time.
The laser beam is always perpendicular to AC and hitting the flat surface of the semi-cylinder at a point that moves from A to C at speed v.
We need to find the time when the light ray emerges from the arc surface ABC.
Consider the angle at which the ray enters the semi-cylinder and find when it reaches the critical angle for total internal reflection.
Ignoring the propagation time of light in the transparent brick means we don't need to worry about the time it takes for the light to travel through the material.
The exit time depends on the position where the ray enters and the speed at which P moves.
Find the relationship between the entry point and the exit point.
